Package voltage.core

Class VoltageComponent

java.lang.Object
voltage.core.VoltageComponent
Direct Known Subclasses:
Jack, MultiJack, VoltageAnalogVUMeter, VoltageAudioBus, VoltageAudioDevice, VoltageButton, VoltageCable, VoltageCanvas, VoltageCurve, VoltageDigitalCounter, VoltageEllipse, VoltageImage, VoltageKeyboard, VoltageKnob, VoltageLabel, VoltageLED, VoltageLine, VoltageMidiBus, VoltagePluginHost, VoltagePolyBus, VoltageRectangle, VoltageRemoteControl, VoltageScrollbar, VoltageSlider, VoltageSound, VoltageSwitch, VoltageViewport, VoltageVUMeter
public abstract class VoltageComponent
extends java.lang.Object
VoltageComponent is the base class for knobs, sliders, buttons and other controls. You can do basic operations on these

    • SetUnits

      public void SetUnits​(java.lang.String units)
      Define the units for this control. Not everything is in Hz or Volts. Maybe it's in goobers? As in 0 to 100 goobers.
      Parameters:
      units - the name of the unit.

      public void SetTransparency​(double transparency)
      Sets the transparency of this control.
      Parameters:
      transparency - 0 - opaque and 1.0 = fully transparent.

    • GetTransparency

      public double GetTransparency()
      Gets the transparency level
      Returns:
      the transparency level 0 - opaque and 1.0 = fully transparent.

    • SetWantsMouseNotifications

      public void SetWantsMouseNotifications​(boolean bWants)
      Sets whether the control wants mouse notifications Messages would be sent to the module's Notify(). Messages can be one of the following: Object_MouseMove Object_MouseLeave Object_LeftButtonDown Object_LeftButtonUp Object_RightButtonDown Object_RightButtonUp
      Parameters:
      bWants - set to true to receive mouse notifications in your module.
      See Also:
      VoltageModule.ModuleNotifications

    • WantsMouseNotifications

      public boolean WantsMouseNotifications()
      Returns whether the object wants mouse notifications.
      Returns:
      if the control wants mouse notifications.

    • SetCanBeAutomated

      public void SetCanBeAutomated​(boolean bCanBeAutomated)
      Can the control be automated?
      Parameters:
      bCanBeAutomated - flag to determine if it can be automated from the DAW

    • SetZOrder

      public void SetZOrder​(int zorder)
      Updates the control z order.
      Parameters:
      zorder - the new z-order for the control. Higher z-order controls will display over lower z-order controls. 0 is the bottom. Use -1 to place it at the top.

    • SkewNormalizedValue

      public double SkewNormalizedValue​(double input)
      Adjusts a normalized control value (0-1.0) to account for skew settings
      Parameters:
      input - the normalized control value, from 0 to 1.0.
      Returns:
      the adjusted normalzied value, accounting for control skew settings
